# Surprise Granite Marble & Quartz
> Arizona's premier countertop and remodeling specialists since 2015

## About Us
Surprise Granite Marble & Quartz is a full-service countertop fabrication and home remodeling company based in Peoria, Arizona. We specialize in premium natural and engineered stone countertops, kitchen remodeling, bathroom remodeling, and cabinet installation for residential and commercial clients throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area.

## Installation Services (Licensed General Contractor ROC#340633)

### Countertop Fabrication & Installation
- **Materials**: Granite, Quartz, Marble, Porcelain, Quartzite
- **Timeline**: 7-10 business days from estimate to installation
- **Price Range**: $40-$150 per square foot installed
- **Includes**: Templating, fabrication, installation, sink cutouts, standard edge, sealing, old countertop removal
- **Service Page**: https://surprisegranite.com/services/countertop-installation/

### Kitchen Remodeling - $15,000-$75,000+
Complete kitchen transformations including countertops, cabinets, backsplash, flooring, plumbing, and electrical.
- **Service Page**: https://surprisegranite.com/services/home/kitchen-remodeling-arizona/

### Bathroom Remodeling - $8,000-$35,000+
Full bathroom renovations: vanities, showers, tile, fixtures, plumbing.
- **Service Page**: https://surprisegranite.com/services/home/bathroom-remodeling-arizona/

### Tile & Backsplash Installation - $8-$25/sq ft installed
Kitchen backsplash, bathroom tile, floor tile, shower tile. All tile types including ceramic, porcelain, glass, and natural stone.
- **Service Page**: https://surprisegranite.com/services/tile-backsplash-installation/

### Custom Showers - $4,000-$15,000+
Complete custom shower builds with tile, glass enclosures, waterproofing (Schluter/RedGard), benches, niches, linear drains.
- **Service Page**: https://surprisegranite.com/services/custom-showers/

### Flooring Installation - $3-$15/sq ft labor
LVP, tile, hardwood, laminate flooring for kitchens, bathrooms, and whole homes. Subfloor prep and transitions included.
- **Service Page**: https://surprisegranite.com/services/flooring-installation/

### Vanity Installation - $300-$800 labor
Bathroom vanity replacement with countertops, sinks, faucets, plumbing. Single, double, and floating vanities.
- **Service Page**: https://surprisegranite.com/services/vanity-installation/

### Tile Shower Remodel - $4,000-$15,000+
Custom tile shower builds with waterproofing (Schluter/RedGard), niches, benches, linear drains, frameless glass. Tub-to-shower conversions starting at $6,000.
- **Service Page**: https://surprisegranite.com/services/tile-shower-remodel/

### Additional Services
- **Countertop Polish & Repair**: Stone polishing, sealing, chip repair, restoration
- **Plumbing Services**: Sink, faucet, garbage disposal installation. Rough-in plumbing for remodels
- **Cabinet Installation**: Kitchen and bathroom cabinet installation and replacement
- **Interior Design**: Consultation and design services for kitchen and bath projects

## Our 5-Step Process
1. **Free In-Home Estimate**: We visit your home, measure your space, and provide a detailed quote with no obligation
2. **Material Selection**: Choose from 500+ granite, quartz, marble, and porcelain options at our showroom or online
3. **Precision Laser Templating**: Digital laser measurements ensure a perfect fit
4. **Custom Fabrication**: CNC precision cutting and hand-polished edges in our facility
5. **Professional Installation**: Expert installation (usually 1 day) with lifetime warranty on workmanship

## Materials We Offer
### Countertop Materials
- **Granite**: Natural stone with unique patterns, heat resistant, durable
- **Quartz**: Engineered stone, non-porous, low maintenance, consistent patterns
- **Marble**: Elegant natural stone, ideal for bathrooms and low-traffic areas
- **Porcelain**: Ultra-thin, heat resistant, scratch resistant slabs
- **Quartzite**: Natural stone, harder than granite, unique veining
- **Travertine**: Natural limestone, warm tones, classic appearance

### Brands We Carry
- Cambria Quartz
- MSI Surfaces
- Silestone by Cosentino
- Caesarstone
- Daltile
- Arizona Tile
- Pental Quartz
- LG Viatera
- Radianz Quartz
- Hanstone Quartz
- And 20+ additional premium brands

## Frequently Asked Questions

### How much do granite countertops cost?
Granite countertops typically range from $40-$100 per square foot installed in the Phoenix area, depending on the stone grade, edge profile, and project complexity.

### How long does countertop installation take?
Most countertop installations are completed in 1-2 days after templating. The full process from template to installation typically takes 7-10 business days.

### Do you offer free estimates?
Yes, we provide free in-home estimates throughout the Phoenix metro area with no obligation.

### What is the difference between granite and quartz?
Granite is a natural stone quarried from the earth with unique patterns, while quartz is an engineered stone made from crushed quartz mixed with resins. Quartz is non-porous and requires less maintenance, while granite offers one-of-a-kind natural beauty.

### Do you offer financing?
Yes, we offer multiple financing options including 0% APR financing for qualified buyers through our financing partners.

### How much does a custom shower cost?
Custom shower builds in Phoenix range from $4,000-$15,000+ depending on size, tile selection, and features like benches, niches, and linear drains.

### Do you do tub-to-shower conversions?
Yes, tub-to-shower conversions are one of our most popular services. We remove the existing tub, install proper waterproofing, and build your custom walk-in shower.

### What's included in countertop installation?
Our all-inclusive pricing covers: digital laser templating, custom fabrication, sink cutouts, standard edge profile, installation, sealing (natural stone), old countertop removal, and plumbing reconnection.

### What flooring do you install?
We install LVP (Luxury Vinyl Plank), tile, hardwood, and laminate flooring. LVP is our most popular choice for Arizona homes due to its waterproof durability.
